intro: Koanophyllon cabaionum, commonly known as the Cabaionum grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in low, compact clumps with narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Koanophyllon cabaionum is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots that help it access groundwater.
